questions.question_text: When should the Show Elements button be used in the Computer Vision wizard?

choices.A: Highlighting all UI elements that have been identified by the Computer Vision analysis.
choices.B: Displaying a list of all available UI elements and their properties.
choices.D: Filtering out specific UI elements from being processed by the Computer Vision engine.
choices.C: Activating a real-time view of the target app's UI during automation.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer A. 
The Show Elements (hotkey: s) button in the wizard highlights all UI elements that have been identified by the Computer Vision analysis, making it easier for you to choose what to interact with.
https://docs.uipath.com/activities/other/latest/ui-automation/using-the-computer-vision-activities

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A. Entry actions, Exit actions, Trigger conditions, and Transitions.

choices.A: Entry actions, Exit actions, Trigger conditions, and Transitions.
choices.D: Entry actions, Exit actions, Guard conditions, and Transitions.
choices.B: Entry actions, Exit actions, Guard and Trigger attributes, and Transitions.
choices.C: Entry actions, Exit actions, Conditional expressions, and Transitions.

questions.question_text: Which major sections can be added or modified in the State activity of a UiPath project that uses State Machines?
In a UiPath State Machine workflow, which section of State activity is used to specify conditional/triggers logic and multiple outgoing transitions in a state machine?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Transitions
The Entry and Exit sections enable you to add entry and exit triggers for the selected state, while the Transition(s) section displays all the transitions linked to the selected state..
https://docs.uipath.com/studio/standalone/2023.10/user-guide/state-machines

questions.question_text: Under what conditions will a trigger be automatically disabled upon failure in Integration Service?

choices.D: When the job is not able to start after 20 attempts for a single event or the job does not start for the last 200 events.
choices.C: When the job is not able to start after 11 attempts for a single event or the job does not start for the last 100 events.
choices.B: When the job is not able to start after 5 attempts for a single event or the job does not start for the last 50 events.
choices.A: When the job is not able to start after 3 attempts for a single event or the job does not start for the last 25 events.
